appearances.title: Washington Journal Washington Journal : CSPAN : January 1, 2026 10:03am-1:28pm EST
appearances.snippet: ashley hinson is a strong favorite to win the nomination.he democratic primary is a three-way race, a very open right now. and there is excitement among democrats to have an open seat. we have not had a senate race without an incumbent for decades. host: governor kim reynolds is governor of your state that does not have term limits for governor, unlike other states. why is she stepping down and how competitive is the race? guest: that was a big surprise because governor reynolds signaled she was likely to run for reelection so it was a surprise in april when she rolled it out. we have can reynolds -- kim reynolds' predecessor is the longest serving governor in u.s. history because we do not have term limits. there are two candidates but the favorite is our state auditor. he has been elected twice statewide. he is currently the only democratic elected official and then there is a wild five way gop primary unlike any primary race i have ever seen. you could say the front runner would be u.s. representative randy feenstra who was elected to con

appearances.title: Washington Journal 01/01/2026 : CSPAN : January 1, 2026 6:59am-10:03am EST

appearances.title: U.S. House of Representatives U.S. House of Representatives : CSPAN : January 8, 2026 2:30pm-6:31pm EST
appearances.snippet: reintroduce the bipartisan gang activity reporting act with my fellow appropriator congresswoman ashley hinson of iowa. this legislation has an urgent purpose to give law enforcement the accurate, comprehensive data they need to combat gang violence and to keep our community safe. from 2021 to 2024, law enforcement agencies reported more than 69,000 incidents of gang activity nation wide. over half involved violent crime. yet today, federal gang data remains fragmented, inconsistent and incomplete, and that gap puts officers at risk and leaves communities, especially in rural america, without the tools needed to respond effectively. our bill would require the attorney general to submit an annual report to congress on gang activity, investigations and prosecutions. while recent fbi data show violent crime trending downward, we know progress does not mean the work is all done. this legislation strengthens public safety, supports law enforcement, and helps protect families from ohio to iowa and coast to coast. i urge my colleagues to please support this critical gang activity reporting act and i
